topic.title: Basic Structure of the Encoding of Lists

body.p: Lists are tagged with the <list> element. Each list item is tagged with <item>[...]</item>. If the list has a title, it is tagged as such by the <head> element.
body.codeblock: <list> <head>[title of the list]</head><!-- where available --> <item>[content of a list item]</item> <item>[content of a list item]</item> </list>
body.p: Numbering of list points is done within <list>[...]</list> (i. e. at text level) and not tagged separately.
body.codeblock: <list> <item>1. [contents of the first list item]</item> <item>2. [contents of the second list item]</item> ... <item>[n]. [contents of the nth list item]</item> </list>

fig.codeblock: <list> <item>[...]</item> <item> <hi rendition="#aq">s)</hi>Der erſte Stein <hi rendition="#aq">a</hi>, auf dem Gewölbefuß liegend, heißt: <hi rendition="#g">An-<lb/> fänger</hi>- oder <hi rendition="#g">Kämpferſtein</hi>. </item><lb/> <item> <hi rendition="#aq">t)</hi>Der Stein <hi rendition="#aq">t</hi> in der oberſten Spitze des Gewölbes heißt:<lb/> <hi rendition="#g">Schlußſtein</hi>. </item><lb/> <item> <hi rendition="#aq">u)</hi>Jede Hälfte eines Gewölbes, welche durch eine verticale, durch<lb/> die Scheitellinie gelegte Ebene gebildet wird, heißt: <hi rendition="#g">Gewölbe-<lb/> ſchenkel</hi>; dieſelben ſind in der Regel ſich gleich, bei einhüftigen Ge-<lb/> wölben (Fig. 256) reſp. Bögen aber ungleich. </item><lb/> <item>[...]</item> </list><lb/>

p.i: Source: Wanderley, Germano: Handbuch der Bauconstruktionslehre. 2. Aufl. Bd. 2. Die Constructionen in Stein. Leipzig, 1878. [Facsimile 267]

body.p: If a list consists of entries with corresponding values, which are separated from each other by a spacer (e. g. an empty space or a dotted line), the distance is displayed by <space dim="horizontal"/>.

Maͤhnklee <space dim="horizontal"/> 325°</item><lb/> <item>4ter Schlag. Rocken <space dim="horizontal"/> 299°</item><lb/> <item>5ter Schlag. Wicken zu Gruͤnfutter <space dim="horizontal"/> 525°</item><lb/> <item>6ter Schlag. Rocken <space dim="horizontal"/> <hi rendition="#u">500°</hi></item> </list>

p.i: Source: Thünen, Johann Heinrich von: Der isolirte Staat in Beziehung auf Landwirthschaft und Nationalökonomie. Hamburg, 1826. [Facsimile 70]

body.p: A typical use case for such lists are Tables of Contents.
Bracketings within lists are tagged with the attribute value pair @rendition="#rightBraced|#leftBraced|#topBraced|#bottomBraced" (see chap. Bracketings).
